also can we use emojis in our questions?

     5 minutes seems way too long if you've never done this before. for me personally, if my first video had to be 5 minutes i would be every kind of lost

12.5.19  10:57 am   12.3.19  3:52 pm ok、 cool. but out of curiosity: when i play chords like Fm/Ab、 it sounds different than Fm/Fb (especially in context)、 but there is no other way to write it、 is there?

     i am 99% sure you made a typo there but i am having trouble deciphering what you most likely would have meant

      since Ab is already part of the Fm chord

     for Fm/Ab to have the effect (enough to make it worth writing it that way) the Ab note needs to probably be somewhere in the bass range. like at least an octave below the rest of the chord. i am entirely unsure of whether that answers the question because the Fm/Fb seemed out of context for multiple reasons

12.5.19  8:20 am   Bill.

I want to learn how to make jingles but when I try doing it, it just sound random and off key, like the chords are fighting with each other rather than working together to create a catch jingle.

I would not want to copy you, but what's your approach to coming up with a jingle and the chords that support it?

     it comes naturally to me, but that's probably because i've spent literally my entire life hearing and experiencing and playing and experimenting with music, up down and slant ways

12.5.19  5:03 am   alright, so, i got this song idea that im struggling with. the intro, just basically slow moody noodling on piano, is fine. then it moves into a syncopated staccato feel in D minor and i want to find a section to bridge between that and a less-momentum-y chorus-esque section, still in D minor. I also am trying to write lyrics for the whole song (on the subject of loneliness and isolation coz thats the concept of the album) and am struggling with that too. do you have any advice for overcoming my musical and poetic writers block or any avenues i could explore that i havent already?

     although i know the meaning of all the terms you used, still the funny thing about music is there is still no way for me to actually have any idea how your song actually goes. what i might dare to recommend, and i recommend this all too often because it has worked very well for me, is try to write much shorter songs so you can more quickly learn the possibilities. even just the amount of time you've spent giving a verbal description of the song, is enough time to lose momentum of the process. need to go much quicker, more carefree. and for now try shorter songs so you can explore the entire process faster and get more of an idea of what the possibilities can be. and beware that trying to explain a song to someone who hasn't heard it, very often kills it

12.5.19  5:00 am   Hey Bill! You don't want to say a bad word about others, you try to give good advice, you're musically talented and probably handsome (can't tell with certainty because of the filters on your videos). How come you are such a swell guy? Were you bullied as a child and grown up to be cool and wiser or... Were you born cool?

     normal. am normal. at least that's what i am telling myself at this moment
